item.description: Play Anything: The Pleasure of Limits, the Uses of Boredom, and the Secret of Games Author: Ian Bogost Reviewed: 3 January 2024 This book is about developing an attitude of play in anything we do. The goal is to make our tasks and projects more engaging and fun, i.e. more fulfilling and rewarding as opposed to being pleasurable. The following two quotes from the book capture the message quite well.
